DataTypes

Description

Contains all types and data that are used in the game of life

Synopsis
  • type Position = (Int, Int)
  • type Grid = [Cell]
  • type FigurePart = [Cell]
  • type Figure = [FigurePart]

    • grid :: Grid
    • running :: Bool
    • step :: Bool
    • startGrid :: Grid
    • cColor :: Color
    • showGrid :: Bool
    • nextFigure :: FigureType
    • stdGen :: StdGen
    }

    • = Dead
    • | Alive

Documentation

type Position = (Int, Int) #

A Cell Position / Coordinate

Upper left corner is (0, 0)

type Grid = [Cell] #

A grid of cells

type FigurePart = [Cell] #

A single part of a Figure

Example-Figure:

O X O <- This is the first FigurePart

X X X <- This is the second FigurePart

O X O <- This is the third FigurePart

type Figure = [FigurePart] #

A figure that can be placed in the game of life.

Example-Figure:

O X O

X X X

O X O

type FigureDescription = [[Int]] #

A description of a Figure using numbers.

This is used to create a Figure (see toFigure).

  • 0 means Dead
  • any other number means Alive

data GameData #

The data of a game state

Constructors

GameData

The random number generator

Fields

  • grid :: Grid

    The grid with cells

  • running :: Bool

    Whether the simulation is running

  • step :: Bool

    Whether we should step one iteration

  • startGrid :: Grid

    The starting grid of this game state

  • cColor :: Color

    The cell color

  • showGrid :: Bool

    Whether we should draw the wire grid | The type of Figure that should be placed with the next click

  • nextFigure :: FigureType
     
  • stdGen :: StdGen
     

data Cell #

A single Game of Life Cell. Either Dead or Alive.

data FigureType #

The different types of Figures that can be placed in the simulation.

Constructors

Means that no figure is selected
